thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Thursday, 19 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Indian shares end higher on gains in metals

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Indian shares end higher on gains in metals
text:
* NSE index up 0.4 pct, BSE index 0.3 pct higher
* NSE metal index gains on strength in global prices
* NSE IT index snaps 3-day losing run
April 19 (Reuters) - Indian shares ended higher on Thursday on gains in metal stocks as global aluminium prices soared, while the countryâ€™s biggest software services exporter Tata Consultancy Services Ltd rose 1 percent ahead of quarterly results.
The broader NSE index ended 0.37 percent higher at 10,565.30, while the benchmark BSE index closed up 0.28 percent at 34,427.29.
The NSE IT index ended 1.1 percent higher, snapping a three-day losing streak, while the NSE metal index gained 4.5 percent.
For the midday report, click
Reporting by Vishal Sridhar in Bengaluru; Editing by Biju Dwarakanath
